questions.question: Why do subscriptions to the Observer begin to drop sharply?

choices.answer: Loyalists were leaving Boston and people couldn't afford to buy the paper.
Bostonians found out it was a Patriot newspaper.
The paper wasn't that good and too many ads.
The Observer was a Loyalist newspaper.

questions.question: Why does a British soldier know Rab down with his sword?

choices.answer: He knew Rab was a Patriot.
It was an accident!
Rab was touching his musket.
Rab's uncle owned the Observer.

questions.question: Why does Johnny agree to deliver mail for the British?

choices.answer: The British needed a loyalist to get their mail.
Dove couldn't do it.
Goblin was faster than any horse in Boston.
So he could get valuable information for Paul Revere.

questions.question: Boston Harbor is closed by the British, yet Boston doesn't starve.  Why not?

choices.answer: Bostonians had stockpiled food and water in case of disaster.
Bostonians fished and farmed to get their own food.
The other towns and colonies sent them food.
The Native Americans gave them food.
He wants to get valuable information from Dove abou the British?
Johnny feels bad about the way he treated Dove at the Laphams.
Mrs. Lapham asked him to take care of Dove.
Dove is sorry for what he did to Johnny's hand.

questions.question: Who is Bessie and why is she important?

choices.answer: Bessie is the horse that Dove is responsible for.
Bessie works at the Observer and is a Patriot spy.
Bessie is a British spy who betrays Paul Revere
Mr. Lyte's housekeeper and has been working for Sam Adams for year.

questions.question: Why does Johnny cut pages out of Mr. Lyte's Bible?

choices.answer: He was going to steal something that Mr. Lyte valued since he took his cup
To hide messages for Paul Revere.
The Bible contained Johnny's family tree proving he was related to Mr. Lyte
They contained a secret code that only the Patriots could decipher.

questions.question: How does Rab become a prisoner of the British soldiers?

choices.answer: A British soldier smuggled his gun into Boston so Rab could buy it.
Rab was identified as one of the Bostonians who dumped tea into the harbor.
Rab walked right through their camp to get his horse.
Rab's uncle owned the Observer, a Patriot newspaper.
She marries Uncle Lorne.
She marries Mr. Lyte.
She marries Paul Revere.
She marries Mr. Tweedie.
General Gage's horse.
Dove's horse.
A British soldier with red hair.
A Patriot minuteman with red hair.

questions.question: James Otis makes a moving speech at the last meeting of the Observers.  How does it affect Johnny?

choices.answer: He quotes from Leviticus in the Bible and Johnny is reminded of freedom.
He says a man has to stand up and Johnny knows they are going to war.
He reads from Thomas Paine's book and Johnny is inspired to join the army.
He tells the Observers that he can no longer be with them and Johnny is sad

questions.question: What happens to Pumpkin in Chapter 9?

choices.answer: He's awarded a medal of bravery by the Observers.
Pumpkin marries Cilla.
Pumpkin is killed by the British
Pumpkin becomes a Patriot farmer.

questions.question: How do Johnny and Rab get Dove to talk?

choices.answer: Jonny blackmails Dove
Johnny tells Dove he'll be his best friend.
Johnny give Dove ale spiked with brandy.
Johnny and Rab threaten to beat him up.

questions.question: Why do the British order Johnny horsewhipped?

choices.answer: They see his letters and know he works for the Boston Observer.
Johnny walked through their camp uninvited.
Johnny is rude to the British officers.
Johnny is a friend of Paul Revere.

questions.question: Why do so many British soldiers desert the army?

choices.answer: They are afraid of the American army.
They secretly support the Patriots.
The Sons of Liberty will mob them.
They think the war will go on forever.
